page.title: 05Bredwardine; Tourism.
page.content: Visitors may stay at the Red Lion Inn and at Bredwardine Hall Guest House, and there are two holiday cottages in Brobury. Holiday-makers visit the area to see places mentioned in 'Kilvert's Diary'. One of these is the Knapp, a prominent hill to the west, topped by beeches in Kilvert's time; these are now dead and have been replaced with oaks by local people. Kilvert was Rector in Bredwardine at the time of his death in 1879; he lies buried in the churchyard. Other tourist attractions include fishing and walking; there are few public footpaths but very good walks on the hill-tops. There is an Outdoor Centre at Bredwardine Lodge which caters for young people with instruction in canoeing and other outdoor pursuits. Moccas Court and Brobury House are also of interest.
